title: Android Weekly Issue #642
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Mobile releases are a silent killer Bouncing back and forth between tools, chasing down marketing for copy and stakeholders for sign-offs, clicking around gingerly in Play Console… productivity, happiness, and general sanity suffer. Learn what makes mobile releases a silent killer and how Runway can help. Custom Sliders in Jetpack Compose sinasamaki shows how to create unique and delightful sliders for your app. ImageVector vs painterResources — Under the hood Sahil Thakar considers when to use ImageVector and painterResources. Sponsored Add paywalls in one line of code Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review. How we improved our 1Weather Android app cold startup time Kapil Sachan shares some tips for improving app startup times. Why fullMode hates Gson so much? theapache64 wrote this blog with a curious mind to understand why Gson started crashing after fullMode was enabled in a working release build. Optimized Image Loading for Compose and Kotlin Multiplatform Jaewoong Eum shows how to easily load network images using an enhanced approach with Landscapist. Inspektify: KMP network inspection library Blaž Vantur introduces Inspektify, a debug tool for observing the app's real-time network traffic. On building a digital assistant for the rest of us - Part 4 Thomas Künneth concludes the series on using Gemini to build a basic digital assistant on Android. Uber's Safe Approach to Mobile Network API Migration Ishan Khanna shares the story of Uber's wild ride from REST to gRPC. Rendering the Java heap as a Treemap Pierre-Yves Ricau writes about a failed experiment with dominator trees. How to Ripple Outside of Compose Material Mark Murphy points out how to fil in various Compose gaps, where Material provides a solution but “you’re on your own” for a custom design system. Paint the Stars - Drawing with Compose and Canvas The first blog post in this series by Eevis Panula is about drawing elements on canvas, and the next one will be about animations. Our journey with compose animations Gustavo Fão Valvassori considers a few pain points when doing animations with compose, how to solve them, and how you can solve the problems now. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Jobs Senior Android Engineer (Dublin, Ireland) We’re looking for a Senior Android Engineer to shape the future of our hugely popular flagship apps— Daft, DoneDeal and Adverts. If you have 6+ years’ experience in Android and love building innovative, scalable features, join our dynamic team and help us push the boundaries of mobile development! Libraries & Code KColor A multiplatform library for sharing color between android and iOS inspektify KMP library for Android and iOS clients for observing real-time network traffic of the app kmplate Kmplate is a template to easily create a new Kotlin Multiplaform project based on Clean Architecture with modularization by features. News Updated production-ready Gemini models Google has released two updated production-ready Gemini models: Gemini-1.5-Pro-002 and Gemini-1.5-Flash-002 along with several improvements. AllTrails gains over 1 million downloads after implementing its Wear OS app Recently, AllTrails' developers created a new Wear OS application. Now, users can access their favorite AllTrails features using their favorite Android wearables. Attestation format change for the Android FIDO2 API Google has announced an attestation format change for the Android FIDO2 API. Koin 4.0 — Official Release Arnaud Giuliani and the Koin team announced the release of Koin 4.0. This new version brings improvements across Kotlin, Android, Compose, and multiplatform APIs. Videos & Podcasts Exploring Kotlin Performance with Romain Guy! Join Two Italian coders for an exciting episode as Romain Guy from Google delves into the nuances of Kotlin performance and optimizations. How easy is it to draw on GoogleMaps using Compose? In this talk, Luca Nicoletti shows how easy it is to draw above a Google Map instance using Jetpack Compose. How to become an Android Developer Do you want to become an Android app developer and boost your programming skills so you will get a well-paid job in IT in 6 to 9 months, even if you have NO PRIOR programming knowledge & experience? Jov Mit shares some tips. AllTrails UI Clone Part Two - List Items In this livestream recording, Adam McNeilly continues recreating the UI of the home screen of the AllTrails application. Gilded Rose Refactoring (2/4) In this video of the Refactoring Gilded Rose series, Charfaoui Younes starts refactoring by removing clutter, reducing complexity of the code, and adding new requirements. Room Renovations Elif shares all the renovations completed recently as Room entered the Kotlin Multiplatform world. How to Implement a Custom Swipe to Reveal in Jetpack Compose Philipp Lackner shows how you can implement a swipe-to-reveal effect for composables inside a LazyColumn. Firebase Auth with Email and Google + Login UI  -  Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to implement an email and Google auth using Firebase! Lazy grids | Compose Tips Learn how grids can sometimes serve as a better alternative, to make these layouts more dynamic and delightful - especially when supporting different window sizes across devices.

html:
Bouncing back and forth between tools, chasing down marketing for copy and stakeholders for sign-offs, clicking around gingerly in Play Console… productivity, happiness, and general sanity suffer. Learn what makes mobile releases a silent killer and how Runway can help.

Take the pain out of configuring and testing your app's paywalls. With RevenueCat Paywalls you can remotely configure and edit your entire paywall view without waiting on App Review.

theapache64 wrote this blog with a curious mind to understand why Gson started crashing after fullMode was enabled in a working release build.

Gustavo Fão Valvassori considers a few pain points when doing animations with compose, how to solve them, and how you can solve the problems now.

We’re looking for a Senior Android Engineer to shape the future of our hugely popular flagship apps— Daft, DoneDeal and Adverts. If you have 6+ years’ experience in Android and love building innovative, scalable features, join our dynamic team and help us push the boundaries of mobile development!

A multiplatform library for sharing color between android and iOS

KMP library for Android and iOS clients for observing real-time network traffic of the app

Kmplate is a template to easily create a new Kotlin Multiplaform project based on Clean Architecture with modularization by features.

Arnaud Giuliani and the Koin team announced the release of Koin 4.0. This new version brings improvements across Kotlin, Android, Compose, and multiplatform APIs.

Do you want to become an Android app developer and boost your programming skills so you will get a well-paid job in IT in 6 to 9 months, even if you have NO PRIOR programming knowledge & experience? Jov Mit shares some tips.

In this video of the Refactoring Gilded Rose series, Charfaoui Younes starts refactoring by removing clutter, reducing complexity of the code, and adding new requirements.

Elif shares all the renovations completed recently as Room entered the Kotlin Multiplatform world.

Learn how grids can sometimes serve as a better alternative, to make these layouts more dynamic and delightful - especially when supporting different window sizes across devices.

]]>
